before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"9ra4v","text":"Please put on your personal protective equipment (PPE) supplied by your instructors. PPE for this lab includes gloves, disposable lab coats, and eye protection. ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"fm6r7","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2b78v","text":"Before you start, clean bench surfaces and pipettors with ethanol. ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"216ge","text":"Overview","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":8},{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d4peq","text":"The bacterial genus Delftia was named for the city of Delft in the Netherlands, where the species type was isolated and for the Delft research groups that had a critical role in the early development of bacteriology. Species of Delftia have since been isolated all over the world in different environments and have been known to cause infections in humans. Delftia are gram-negative rod-shaped aerobes. Species of Delftia are often resistant to several compounds, including the common disinfectant chlorhexidine,2 most antibiotics in the aminoglycoside group,3 and heavy metals.4 One of Delftia’s most surprising talents is its ability to concentrate heavy metals like gold.5 Biofilms found on gold deposits suggest that these bacteria are responsible for their formation.6 Known species of Delftia include D. acidovorans, D. tsuruhatensis, D. deserti, D. lucustris, and D. litopenaei. Refer to Figure 1 for an example of Delftia acidovorans colonies growing on tryptic soy agar (TSA).","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":20,"length":8},{"style":"italic","offset":228,"length":8},{"style":"italic","offset":357,"length":8},{"style":"italic","offset":414,"length":8},{"style":"bold","offset":895,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a7djb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"obx6j","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5oh7i","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7a7oq","text":"Where are Delftia spp.found?","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":28}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cfe73","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"49ftt","text":"Delftia spp. are commonly isolated from aquatic environments such as lakes7 and wastewater8 and are thought to be ubiquitous. Because of their affinity for aquatic environments, Delftia have been identified in organisms and objects frequently found in these environments, such as mosquitoes9 and birds’ feathers.10Delftia aren’t just aquatic microbes, though. These bacteria have been identified in unexpected places like desert soil11 and contact lens cases.12","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2qrvu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fjckl","text":"An Opportunistic Pathogen","type":"header-three","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":25}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bp5jt","text":"","type":"header-three","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b1fc0","text":"Species of Delftia have been known to cause various infections in healthy and immunocompromised people. Many of these infections are (IV) line-related,13,14 but other infections have occurred due to intravenous drug use.3Delftia were also implicated in eye inflammation related to contact lens use.12 NC State students and staff have even found Delftia DNA in surveys of kitchen sinks performed by students in the BIT 477/577 Metagenomics labmodule!","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f7s8t","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"70k1i","text":"Our Project","type":"header-three","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"en2d1","text":"","type":"header-three","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"apu32","text":"We will set up a series of high-throughput (HT) assays to test whether different gold chloride concentrations inhibit the growth of different Delftia strains. Gold chloride has been explored for its antibacterial properties15. However, Delftia spp. have a unique non-ribosomal peptide that helps relieve gold toxicity by producing delftibactin5. ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":331,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c9tau","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b381k","text":"Bacterial strains will be grown in 96-well plates to test multiple concentrations of gold chloride and antibiotics and the effect of miniaturization of the assay. We will set up plates in the first lab session to test several strains at multiple doses with numerous replicates. Plates will incubate for one day at 30ºC before assessing cell viability using a stain for metabolic activity, PrestoBlue®. This approach can be adapted to screen active compounds from a high-throughput screening (HTS) campaign. For this first compound screen, we will focus on the effects of automation and miniaturization on assay reproducibility.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":133,"length":15},{"style":"bold","offset":492,"length":3},{"style":"bold","offset":560,"length":67}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"neaq","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5r9q4","text":"We will test gold chloride concentrations in a twelve-point dose-response curve. At the end of this experiment, you can determine which concentrations are inhibitory by calculating the percent growth inhibition and IC50. We will compare the susceptibility of various Delftia strains.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":112,"length":108}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6a4rb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"FBE0C910BC1411EDA55C0A58A9FEAC02","height":"341","id":"FC2340D0BC1411ED9BC159B18F516EDC","is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"6m9m1\",\"text\":\"Figure 1.Delftia acidovorans colonies growing on tryptic soy agar (TSA)\",\"type\":\"align-center\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[{\"style\":\"bold\",\"offset\":0,\"length\":9},{\"style\":\"italic\",\"offset\":9,\"length\":19}],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":[]},{\"key\":\"9reud\",\"text\":\"\",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":[]}],\"entityMap\":{}}","mime":null,"nestedSelector":null,"original_name":null,"placeholder":"https://lh4.googleusercontent.com/0-051jc4xyIrYcyJb1NwQ2J2Pmrk6l4MdRfuYPeFYtjU_T1tET2amjQBzFNklrXuA-kNv7dkvfxsw0GtlMpLRbWZB8yTX7FDv5MAnW2aEbeKrKMw3hEFpi1NEVz-yGQ29GsKsr1j2vrrMOmVBfi0fQw","shadow":false,"source":"https://lh4.googleusercontent.com/0-051jc4xyIrYcyJb1NwQ2J2Pmrk6l4MdRfuYPeFYtjU_T1tET2amjQBzFNklrXuA-kNv7dkvfxsw0GtlMpLRbWZB8yTX7FDv5MAnW2aEbeKrKMw3hEFpi1NEVz-yGQ29GsKsr1j2vrrMOmVBfi0fQw","width":"256"}}}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"8he62","text":"Read the procedure listed below. Discuss with your lab partner the key steps to program the liquid handler to successfully complete this task. Pay attention to the reagents, tube format, and equipment we have. Remember the goal: reproducibly testing compounds (with replicates) and including negative and positive controls.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":229,"length":13}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cgcvk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"tmquf","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"7FBFE60FBC1511EDA55C0A58A9FEAC02","height":406.1858974358974,"id":"80028FA0BC1511ED9BC159B18F516EDC","is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"6vb6g\",\"text\":\"Figure 1. Schematic of procedure to use liquid handler to seed plates with bacteria and treatments. A set of Delftia spp. Bacterial isolates were grown on Tryptic Soy Agar (TSA) and then liquid broth (Tryptic Soy Broth) before diluting to a specific OD600. The eqMotion 5075 liquid handler was used to seed plates with bacteria and treatments: water/buffer control (negative control), antibiotic (positive control), and gold chloride (test compound). Plates were incubated with shaking in a LogPhase 600 for 24 hours with OD600 readings obtained every 10 min. After 24 hours, Invitrogen PrestoBlue viability stain was added to all wells to quantify viability. Each condition was tested in triplicate wells for calculations of inhibitory concentrations. Created with BioRender.com.\",\"type\":\"align-left\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[{\"style\":\"bold\",\"offset\":0,\"length\":99},{\"style\":\"sub\",\"offset\":252,\"length\":3},{\"style\":\"sub\",\"offset\":524,\"length\":3}],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}},{\"key\":\"boahr\",\"text\":\"\",\"type\":\"align-left\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}},{\"key\":\"5ogd5\",\"text\":\"As a group, we will use a common script and the liquid handler to prepare sets of plates for analyses. Each bay will set up one plate.\",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}}],\"entityMap\":{}}","mime":null,"nestedSelector":null,"original_name":null,"placeholder":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/AtqvA_kbV6CItZAjoRVFGtywg6F6T2ej7Hh6OC3ldHrN0NOwInQg6WVIkSNF88A_azUnL8gVgLZryYOhAbo3sqPPEmyCcGmbGPx6q511BLjW5bCxRjSf-dcSMBFRPjNRnqPZzn9NL-Sbl0U83kyMC6k","shadow":false,"source":"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/AtqvA_kbV6CItZAjoRVFGtywg6F6T2ej7Hh6OC3ldHrN0NOwInQg6WVIkSNF88A_azUnL8gVgLZryYOhAbo3sqPPEmyCcGmbGPx6q511BLjW5bCxRjSf-dcSMBFRPjNRnqPZzn9NL-Sbl0U83kyMC6k","width":580}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fs207","text":"Grow    cultures of Delftia spp. in   of TSB, shaking at   and incubating at   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":20,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":5,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":36,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":57,"length":1},{"key":3,"offset":77,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5t06v","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":0,"guid":"5993E340BC1611ED9BC159B18F516EDC","id":"82957","label":"","pause":null,"preset":["overnight"],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"2.5","error":false,"guid":"2A7AB2A0BC1611ED9BC159B18F516EDC","id":"93688","label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"2":{"type":"shaker","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":0,"error_shaker":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"0FE29E80BC5711ED9BC159B18F516EDC","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":{"shaker":false,"temperature":false},"shaker":"200-250","start":null,"temperature":"","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":33}},"3":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"4766B850BC1611ED9BC159B18F516EDC","id":"51713","label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"30","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"783sg","text":"For each strain, subculture the bacteria to approximately 5 x 105 CFU in    of fresh TSB by performing the following:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":64,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":73,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"ajocd","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"25","error":false,"guid":"73D84890BC1611ED9BC159B18F516EDC","id":"93689","label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4nrmm","text":"Measure the OD600 of the overnight culture (1:10 dilution in TSB);","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":14,"length":3}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f28mn","text":"Plug this number into the formula at the bottom of the page and multiply by 10 to ensure we have enough bacteria in each well.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2vs0n","text":"Take the calculated amount (μL) from the overnight culture and add to    of fresh tryptic soy broth (TSB); mix well.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":70,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"ed4gs","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"25","error":false,"guid":"AA754D30BC1611ED9BC159B18F516EDC","id":"93690","label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"59qj4","text":"Add    of diluted bacterial suspension into each well of columns 2-12.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":4,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7g7sv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"100","error":false,"guid":"C6221C20BC1611ED9BC159B18F516EDC","id":"93691","label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}
